questions.question: What is Ancestra Business Manager?
questions.answer: Ancestra is your complete business management system. It helps you track inventory, record sales, manage expenses, monitor employee performance, and generate financial reports—all in one place.

questions.question: How do I log in?
questions.answer: Enter your username and password on the login page. If you're the business owner, use the credentials you set up during installation (default is username: 'owner', password: 'owner123').

questions.question: What can I do as a cashier?
questions.answer: As a cashier, you can view stock levels, record sales, and see your own sales history. You won't have access to reports, expenses, employee management, or settings.

questions.question: What can owners and managers do?
questions.answer: Owners and managers have full access to all features including adding products, managing inventory, viewing all sales, tracking expenses, generating reports, creating users, and configuring settings.

questions.question: What does the Dashboard show?
questions.answer: The Dashboard gives you a quick overview of your business: total revenue, expenses, net profit, number of orders, today's sales, best-selling products, and low-stock alerts.

questions.question: How do I refresh the Dashboard?
questions.answer: The Dashboard updates automatically when you navigate to it. You can also refresh your browser to see the latest data.

questions.question: What are low stock items?
questions.answer: Low stock items are products where the current quantity has reached or fallen below the reorder level you set. This helps you know when to restock before running out.

questions.question: How do I see my best-selling products?
questions.answer: Check the 'Best sellers' section on your Dashboard. It shows your top 5 products based on quantity sold, along with revenue and stock status.

questions.question: How do I add a new product?
questions.answer: Go to Stock (Inventory), fill in the 'Add new product' form with the product name, category, price, quantity, and reorder level, then click 'Add product'. The product code is auto-generated for you.

questions.question: What is a product code?
questions.answer: A product code is a unique identifier for each item (like PROD-0001). Ancestra generates this automatically when you add a product—you don't need to enter it yourself.

questions.question: How do I update stock quantities?
questions.answer: On the Inventory page, use the 'Update product quantity' section. Search for the product, enter how many units to add, and click 'Update quantity'. This increases your stock level.

questions.question: Can I search for products?
questions.answer: Yes! Use the search box in the 'Update product quantity' section or when adding products to a sale. You can search by product name or product code.

questions.question: How do I import products from a CSV file?
questions.answer: Go to Inventory, click 'Download Sample CSV' to see the format, prepare your file with columns (name, product_code, category, price, quantity, reorder_level), then click 'Import CSV' and select your file.

questions.question: Can I export my inventory to CSV?
questions.answer: Yes. On the Inventory page, click 'Export CSV'. Your browser will download a file with all your products, including product codes, quantities, and prices.

questions.question: What does the reorder level mean?
questions.answer: The reorder level is the minimum quantity you want to keep in stock. When your inventory reaches this number, the product appears in low-stock alerts so you know to reorder.

questions.question: Can I update or create products with CSV import?
questions.answer: Yes. If the product code in your CSV already exists, it updates that product. If it's new, it creates a new product. You'll see a summary showing how many were created, updated, or skipped.

questions.question: What do the stock status icons mean?
questions.answer: Green checkmark means the product is in stock. Orange alert means low stock (at or below reorder level). Red X means out of stock (quantity is zero).

questions.question: How do I record a sale?
questions.answer: Go to Sales, search for a product, select it, enter the quantity, and click 'Add to sale'. Repeat for more items. Optionally add a customer name and choose payment method, then click 'Complete Sale'.

questions.question: Can I add multiple items to one sale?
questions.answer: Absolutely! Keep adding products to build up your sale. You'll see a running total at the bottom. When you're ready, click 'Complete Sale' to finalize the transaction.

questions.question: What payment methods are supported?
questions.answer: You can choose Cash, Mobile Money, Card, or Bank Transfer when recording a sale. Select the method that matches how your customer paid.

questions.question: How do I remove an item from a sale?
questions.answer: In the 'Items in sale' list, click the 'Remove' button next to any product you want to take out before completing the sale.

questions.question: Can I see a receipt after making a sale?
questions.answer: Yes! After you complete a sale, a receipt preview appears on the right side showing all items, totals, payment method, and your company details.

questions.question: What if I try to sell more than I have in stock?
questions.answer: Ancestra checks your inventory automatically. If you try to add more quantity than available, you'll see an error message telling you how many units are actually in stock.

questions.question: How do I view past sales?
questions.answer: Scroll down on the Sales page to see 'Sales history'. You'll see all completed sales with customer name, date/time, payment method, and total amount.

questions.question: Can I filter sales by date?
questions.answer: Yes. In the 'Sales history' section, use the 'Start date' and 'End date' filters, then click 'Apply filters'. Or use quick buttons like 'Today', 'This month', or 'All time'.

questions.question: Can I search for a specific customer's sales?
questions.answer: Yes. Enter the customer name in the 'Customer name' filter box and click 'Apply filters' to see only sales for that customer.

questions.question: Can cashiers see all sales?
questions.answer: No. Cashiers only see sales they personally recorded. Owners and managers can see all sales from all employees.

questions.question: How do I view a receipt for a past sale?
questions.answer: In the Sales history table, click the 'View receipt' button next to any sale. The receipt will appear on the right showing all the details.

questions.question: How do I record a business expense?
questions.answer: Go to Expenses, fill in the description, select a category (Rent, Utilities, Salaries, Supplies, Marketing, or Other), enter the amount and date, optionally attach a receipt image, then click 'Record expense'.

questions.question: Can I attach receipt photos to expenses?
questions.answer: Yes! When adding an expense, click 'Choose file' to upload a photo or scan of your receipt. This helps you keep records organized.

questions.question: How do I see all my expenses?
questions.answer: All recorded expenses appear in the list at the bottom of the Expenses page, showing description, category, amount, date, and any attached receipt.

questions.question: Can I filter expenses by date or category?
questions.answer: Yes. Use the 'Start date', 'End date', and 'Category' filters at the top of the expenses list, then click 'Apply filters' to narrow down the results.

questions.question: Can cashiers record expenses?
questions.answer: No. Only owners and managers can record and view expenses. Cashiers don't have access to the Expenses page.

questions.question: How do I view an attached receipt?
questions.answer: In the expenses list, if a receipt is attached, click the 'View receipt' link next to that expense. It will open the image in a new tab.

questions.question: How do I view financial reports?
questions.answer: Go to Reports to see your financial overview including sales, expenses, and profit broken down by day, week, and month, plus a 7-day sales vs expenses chart.

questions.question: Can I export reports as PDF?
questions.answer: Yes! On the Reports page, click 'Export PDF' at the top right. A professionally formatted PDF with your Ancestra branding will download automatically.

questions.question: What's included in the PDF report?
questions.answer: The PDF includes: total sales, expenses, and profit summary; daily/weekly/monthly breakdowns; 7-day sales vs expenses; best-selling products; low stock alerts; and today's statistics.

questions.question: How often should I check reports?
questions.answer: It's up to you! Many business owners check daily to monitor today's sales, weekly to spot trends, and monthly for deeper analysis. Click 'Refresh' to update the data anytime.

questions.question: Can cashiers access reports?
questions.answer: No. Reports are only available to owners and managers who need to analyze overall business performance.

questions.question: How do I add a new employee or user?
questions.answer: Go to Settings, scroll to 'Create new user', enter their username, full name, assign a role (Owner, Manager, or Cashier), set a password, and click 'Create user'.

questions.question: What's the difference between Owner, Manager, and Cashier roles?
questions.answer: Owners have full access to everything. Managers can do everything except create users. Cashiers can only view stock and record their own sales—they can't see reports, expenses, or settings.

questions.question: How do I see what my team is doing?
questions.answer: Go to Employees to see each team member's role, sales performance, and recent activity. You can filter by 'Last 7 days', 'This month', 'Past 3 months', or 'All time'.

questions.question: Can I track who made each sale?
questions.answer: Yes. Every sale is automatically linked to the user who recorded it. Check the Employees page to see each person's sales stats and activity log.

questions.question: What does the activity log show?
questions.answer: The activity log shows recent actions like sales recorded, products added, and other key events, along with timestamps. This helps you monitor what's happening in your business.

questions.question: Can I see individual employee performance?
questions.answer: Yes. The Employees page shows sales count, total revenue, and average sale value for each team member. Use the date range selector to analyze different periods.

questions.question: How do I customize my receipts?
questions.answer: Go to Settings, scroll to 'Receipt settings', and update your company name, tagline, and footer message. These details appear on every receipt.

questions.question: Can I add my company logo to receipts?
questions.answer: Yes! In Settings under 'Receipt settings', click 'Choose file' to upload your logo. It will appear on printed and digital receipts.

questions.question: What should I put in the footer message?
questions.answer: The footer message appears at the bottom of receipts. You could add 'Thank you for your business!', your return policy, contact info, or business hours—whatever helps your customers.

questions.question: Can cashiers change settings?
questions.answer: No. Only the business owner can access Settings to create users and update receipt configurations.

questions.question: How do I change my password?
questions.answer: Currently, password changes need to be done by the business owner through the user creation/management system. Contact your owner if you need a password reset.

questions.question: Why can't I see the Dashboard or Reports?
questions.answer: If you're logged in as a Cashier, you only have access to Stock and Sales pages. Dashboard, Reports, Expenses, Employees, and Settings are for Owners and Managers only.

questions.question: Why does it say a product is out of stock when I try to sell it?
questions.answer: The product's quantity in inventory is zero or too low for the amount you're trying to sell. Go to Inventory to update the stock quantity first.

questions.question: My CSV import didn't work. What should I do?
questions.answer: Make sure your CSV has the correct headers: name, product_code, category, price, quantity, reorder_level. Download the sample CSV to see the exact format, then try again.

questions.question: I can't export the PDF report. What's wrong?
questions.answer: Make sure you're logged in and have an active internet connection. If the problem continues, try refreshing the page and clicking 'Export PDF' again.

questions.question: How do I fix 'Failed to load' errors?
questions.answer: This usually means the server isn't running or you lost connection. Check that the backend is running, refresh your page, and try again. Contact your system administrator if it persists.

questions.question: The receipt preview isn't showing. Why?
questions.answer: Receipt preview appears after you complete a sale or click 'View receipt' in sales history. Make sure you've finalized the transaction first.

questions.question: Can I undo a sale I just recorded?
questions.answer: Currently, sales can't be deleted or reversed from the app. If you made a mistake, note it down and adjust your inventory manually or contact your manager for help.

questions.question: How often should I update my inventory?
questions.answer: Update your inventory whenever you receive new stock. You can add individual products or use CSV import for bulk updates to keep quantities accurate.

questions.question: What's the best way to organize my products?
questions.answer: Use clear, consistent category names like 'Electronics', 'Clothing', 'Food & Beverages', etc. This makes it easier to filter, search, and analyze your inventory.

questions.question: Should I always add a customer name to sales?
questions.answer: Customer name is optional, but adding it helps you track repeat customers, follow up on purchases, and build better customer relationships.

questions.question: How do I avoid running out of stock?
questions.answer: Set smart reorder levels for each product. Check the low stock alerts on your Dashboard regularly and restock before you hit zero.

questions.question: What categories should I use for expenses?
questions.answer: Use the preset categories (Rent, Utilities, Salaries, Supplies, Marketing, Other) to keep your expenses organized. Consistent categorization makes reports more useful.

questions.question: How can I improve my sales performance?
questions.answer: Check the Employees page to see which team members are performing well and learn from them. Review best-sellers in your Dashboard to focus on high-demand products.

questions.question: When should I generate a PDF report?
questions.answer: Export reports monthly for your records, quarterly for deeper analysis, or whenever you need to share financial summaries with partners, accountants, or investors.

questions.question: What is net profit?
questions.answer: Net profit is your total sales minus total expenses. It shows how much money your business actually made after covering all costs.

questions.question: What does 'Sales today' mean?
questions.answer: Sales today is the total revenue from all sales recorded since midnight. It resets every day and helps you track daily performance.

questions.question: How is the best seller list calculated?
questions.answer: Best sellers are ranked by total quantity sold (not revenue). Products that sold the most units appear at the top, helping you identify customer favorites.

questions.question: What's the difference between sales and revenue?
questions.answer: In Ancestra, 'sales' and 'revenue' mean the same thing—the total money you've earned from selling products, before subtracting expenses.

questions.question: How do I know if my business is profitable?
questions.answer: Check your net profit on the Dashboard or Reports page. If it's positive, you're making more than you're spending. If negative, your expenses exceed your sales.

questions.question: What's the fastest way to record a sale?
questions.answer: Go to Sales, type the product name or code in the search box, select it, enter quantity, click 'Add to sale', then hit the big 'Complete Sale' button at the bottom.

questions.question: How do I quickly see today's sales?
questions.answer: On the Sales page, click the 'Today' button under sales history to filter and see only today's transactions.

questions.question: Can I see this month's sales quickly?
questions.answer: Yes. On the Sales page, click 'This month' to filter the sales history to the current month.

questions.question: How do I check if a product is in stock fast?
questions.answer: Go to Inventory and use the search bar in the product list, or start typing in the Sales page product search—both show stock levels instantly.

questions.question: What's the quickest way to add stock?
questions.answer: Use the 'Update product quantity' section on the Inventory page. Search for the product, enter how many to add, and click update. Done in seconds.
